description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: User loads and accesses the Web Application

expectedResults.eResult: All nodes and relationships existing in the Neo4j database are graphed.

actualResults.aResult: All nodes and relationships existing in the Neo4j database are graphed.

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Enter host: 52.4.114.120, port: 7474, username: neo4j, password: merck123

expectedResults.eResult: All nodes and relationships existing in the Merck Neo4j database are graphed.

actualResults.aResult: All nodes and relationships existing in the Merck Neo4j database are graphed.

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Give the node a label (i.e. name)
Add a property such as 'Color' with a value of 'Green'

expectedResults.eResult: A new Node is added and is present on the visualization

actualResults.aResult: A new Node is added and is present on the visualization

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Double click in any empty space on the visualization to create a new node
Give the node a label (i.e. name)
Add a property such as 'Color' with a value of 'Green'

expectedResults.eResult: A new Node is added and is present on the visualization

actualResults.aResult: A new Node is added and is present on the visualization

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select an existing node by left clicking on it

expectedResults.eResult: The selected node is removed

actualResults.aResult: The selected node is removed

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select an existing node by left clicking on it
Press the 'Delete' key on the user's physical keyboard

expectedResults.eResult: The selected node is removed

actualResults.aResult: The selected node is removed

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Click the 'Create Relationship' button in the GUI
Click the 'From Node' button and select the starting node
Click the 'To Node' button and select the node to create a relationship to

expectedResults.eResult: An arrow will appear, connecting the two nodes

actualResults.aResult: An arrow will appear, connecting the two nodes

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Click the 'Create Relationship' button in the GUI
Enter a node ID in the 'From Node' input box
Enter a node ID in the 'To Node' input box

expectedResults.eResult: An arrow will appear, connecting the two nodes

actualResults.aResult: An arrow will appear, connecting the two nodes

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select and existing relationship (arrow) from the visualization via left mouse click

expectedResults.eResult: The selected relationship between two nodes is removed

actualResults.aResult: The selected relationship between two nodes is removed

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select and existing relationship (arrow) from the visualization via left mouse click
Press the physical 'Delete' key on the keyboard

expectedResults.eResult: The selected relationship between two nodes is removed

actualResults.aResult: The selected relationship between two nodes is removed

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select a node from the visualization

expectedResults.eResult: The property has been updated

actualResults.aResult: The property has been updated

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select a node from the visualization
Remove a property by clicking the 'x' icon next to that property

expectedResults.eResult: The property has been removed

actualResults.aResult: The property has been removed

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select a relationship (arrow) between two connected nodes
Modify the properties of the relationship

expectedResults.eResult: The property of the relationship has been updated

actualResults.aResult: The property of the relationship has been updated

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select a relationship (arrow) between two connected nodes
Remove a property by clicking the 'x' icon next to that property

expectedResults.eResult: The property of the relationship has been removed

actualResults.aResult: The property of the relationship has been removed

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select the 'Search All Properties' radio button
In the search bar search for an actor ex: Kevin Bacon

expectedResults.eResult: The visualization displays the results of the search as nodes with any property containing that search term and their directly connected neighbors

actualResults.aResult: The visualization displays the results of the search as nodes with any property containing that search term and their directly connected neighbors

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: Select the 'name' property in the drop-down menu
In the search bar search for an actor ex: Kevin Bacon

expectedResults.eResult: The visualization displays the results of the search as nodes with name property containing that search term and their directly connected neighbors

actualResults.aResult: The visualization displays the results of the search as nodes with name property containing that search term and their directly connected neighbors

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: In the search bar search for an actor ex: Kevin Bacon

expectedResults.eResult: Any node that contains the filtered query remain the same while other/un-related nodes be grayed out

actualResults.aResult: Any node that contains the filtered query remain the same while other/un-related nodes are grayed out

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database.
description.step: In the search bar search for an non-existent result: fdsafdsa

expectedResults.eResult: All nodes are grayed out

actualResults.aResult: All nodes are grayed out

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database with data.
description.step: Left mouse click onto any node on the visualization
Click on the Tree Walk button in the tool-bar

expectedResults.eResult: Any and all neighbors of the selected node will be displayed by appending the current visualization

actualResults.aResult: Any and all neighbors of the selected node will be displayed by appending the current visualization

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database with data.
description.step: Left mouse click onto any node on the visualization that is known to have no unvisualized connected neighbors (This can be done by choosing the same node as that in UC10 Tree Walk after that test has been run)
Click on the Tree Walk button in the tool-bar

expectedResults.eResult: An error message is displayed stating that "There are no hidden neighbors of this node"

actualResults.aResult: An error message is displayed stating that "There are no hidden neighbors of this node"

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database with data.
description.step: In the panel displayed on the right of the application click the “From” button and then using the cursor click on a starting node on the visualization.
Proceed by clicking the “To” button and selection another node,

expectedResults.eResult: The shortest path(s) will be displayed in the visualization.

actualResults.aResult: The shortest path(s) will be displayed in the visualization.

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database with data.
description.step: In the panel displayed on the right of the application and manually provide the node IDs for the “To” and “From” fields.

expectedResults.eResult: The shortest path(s) will be displayed in the visualization.

actualResults.aResult: The shortest path(s) will be displayed in the visualization.

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI is successfully connected to the database with data.
description.step: Click the Advance mode button on the tool-bar
A developer console input box will display at the bottom of the application. Proceed by supplying any custom cypher query
Press the “Enter” key on the keyboard.

expectedResults.eResult: A new window will open up with the result of the query in AJAX

actualResults.aResult: A new window will open up with the result of the query in AJAX

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI
description.step: Click the Application Preferences button on the tool bar
In the panel on the right, under Node Displayed Properties, change the Person property to 'name'

expectedResults.eResult: The graph is re-visualized with the Actors names as node labels

actualResults.aResult: The graph is re-visualized with the Actors names as node labels

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI
description.step: Click the Application Preferences button on the tool bar
Select 'Stationary Force Graph' in the drop-down box

expectedResults.eResult: The graph will be re-visualized using the stationary force graph algorithm

actualResults.aResult: The graph will be re-visualized using the stationary force graph algorithm

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI, connected to the database and contains data. Hover mode is currently disabled
description.step: Activate Hover Mode by clicking the Hover mode icon from the Toolbar

expectedResults.eResult: A popup window displays information summary about the node being hovered over

actualResults.aResult: A popup window displays information summary about the node being hovered over

description.precondition: The Neo4j database is running and the Web UI, connected to the database and contains data. Hover Mode is currently Enabled.
description.step: Disable hover mode by clicking on the Hover mode icon on the tool bar

expectedResults.eResult: Nothing happens

actualResults.aResult: Nothing happens
